BiblioData.Title: PROCESS FOR PRODUCING METAL NANOPARTICLES AND PROCESS FOR PRODUCING ACETYLIDES PROCESS
BiblioData.Abstract: A process for making high metal content stabilised metal nanoparticles, comprises reacting at least one metal acetylide with at least one amine or amine salt in the presence of a first solvent under reducing conditions to yield a metal colloid solution and then recovering metal nanoparticles as a precipitate by either evaporating the first solvent or adding a second solvent to the first solvent. The metal colloid solution obtainable as an intermediate by such a process and the high metal content stabilised metal nanoparticles obtainable as the final product of such a process are also disclosed. A process for making gold phenylacetylides, suitable for use as the at least one metal acetylide in the above process, is also disclosed.; The process comprises reacting an aqueous solution of at least one gold salt with at least reducing agent in the presence of water to form a gold intermediate and then reacting the intermediate with a phenylacetylene in the presence of at least one alcohol and a de-protonating agent.

Claims.P: CLAIMS

1. A process for making high metal content stabilised metal nanoparticles, which process comprising reacting at least one metal acetylide with at least one amine or amine salt in the presence of a first solvent under reducing conditions to yield a metal colloid solution and then recovering metal nanoparticles as a precipitate by either:
(a) evaporating the first solvent; or
(b) adding a second solvent to the first solvent.

2. A process according to claim 1, wherein the at least one metal acetylide is reduced by carrying out the reaction between the at least one metal acetylide and the at least one amine at a temperature of from 70 <0>C to 200 <0>C.
3. A process according to claim 1, wherein the at least one metal acetylide is reduced using a chemical reductant.
4. A process according to claim 1, wherein the at least one metal acetylide is reduced by exposure to electromagnetic radiation.
5. A process according to any preceding claim, wherein the at least one amine is a simple amine, a polyamine, an aromatic amine, a surfactant amine or a functionalised amine.

6. A process according to claim 5, wherein the simple amine is selected from the list consisting of oleylamine, hexylamine, octylamine, nonylamine, decylamine, dodecylamine, dimethyl dodecylamine tridecylamine, di(allyl)amine, propylamine, ethylamine, triethylamine, nonylamine, octadecylamine, hexadecylamine and polyoxyalkylene amines.

7. A process according to claim 5, wherein the polyamine is selected from the list consisting of 2-hydroxyethyl ethylene diamine, hexamethylene diamine, decyl dipropylene triamine, triethylene tetramine, tetraethylene triamine, tetraethylene pentamine and pentaethylene tetramine.

8. A process according to claim 5, wherein the aromatic amine is selected from the list consisting of xylylene diamine, 4,4 '-methylene bis(2,6-diethylaniline), 4-hexoylaniline, aminoethyl piperazine and 1,4- bis(3-aminopropyl) piperazine.

9. A process according to claim 5, wherein the surfactant amine is selected from the list consisting of cocoamine, strearylamine, stearamido propyl dimethylamine, tallow amine, tallow propylene diamine, tallow dipropylene triamine, N-oleyl- 1,3-diaminopropane, N-(tallow alkyl)- 1,3 -propane diamine, oleamido propyl dimethylamine, aminodecanoic acids, fatty amino acids and fatty acid hydrazides.

10. A process according to claim 5, wherein the functionalised amine is selected from the list consisting of tyramine, dimethyl aminopropyl methacrylamide, dimethyl aminoethyl methacrylate, dimethyl aminopropyl acrylamide, 3-(2-aminoethylamino) propyl trimethoxy silane, 3-phenyl propylamine, 2,4,8, 10-tetraoxaspiro (5,5) undecane-3,9-dipropanamine, 2-amino-2-methyl-l-propanol, olelyl imidazoline and 2-(2-aminoethylamino)ethanol.
11. A process according to any of claims 1 to 5, wherein the amine salt is selected from the salts of any of the amines in claims 6 to 10.
12. A process according to any preceding claim, wherein the at least one metal in the at least one metal acetylide is selected from the platinum group metals and the coinage metals.
13. A process according to claim 12, wherein the at least one metal is silver or gold and the process is carried out in air.
14. A process according to claim 12, wherein the at least one metal is copper and the process is carried out under an inert atmosphere.

15. A process according to any preceding claim, wherein the at least one metal acetylide is selected from the group consisting of metal phenylacetlyides, metal alkynyl cyclohexanols, metal alkynes or metal alkynols.

16. A process according to any preceding claim, wherein the first solvent is selected from the list consisting of xylene, Shellsol, toluene, mesitylene, cyclohexanone, cyclohexanol, dimethylacetamide and dime thy lformamide.
17. A process according to any preceding claim, wherein the second solvent is selected from the list consisting of methanol, ethanol, iso-propanol, acetone, acetonitrile and hexane.
18. A metal colloid solution obtainable as an intermediate in a process according to any preceding claim.
19. A metal colloid solution according to claim 16, wherein the solution absorbs UV -visible light in the wavelength range of from 510 to 540 nm, from 395 to 425 nm or from 555 to 585 nm.
20. A metal colloid solution according to claim 18 or 19, wherein the solution remains stable for a period of at least 3 months.
21. High metal content stabilised metal nanoparticles obtainable by a process according to any of claims 1 to 17.
22. High metal content stabilised metal nanoparticles according to claim 21, wherein the nanoparticles have a diameter of from 2 to 10 nm.

23. A process for making a gold phenylacetylide, which process comprising reacting an aqueous solution of at least one gold salt with at least one reducing agent in the presence of water to form a gold intermediate and then reacting the intermediate with a phenylacetylene in the presence of at least one alcohol and a de-protonating agent.
24. A process according to claim 23, wherein the reducing agent comprises a substituted alkyl sulphide or a hydroxylamine salt.
25. A process according to claim 23 or 24, wherein the process is carried out at ambient temperature
26. A process according to claim 23, 24 or 25, wherein the at least one gold salt is a halide or ammonium gold salt.
27. A process according to claim 26, wherein the at least one gold salt is chloroauric acid.
